conclusion: Analyzing liquid flow from top containers (A, B, C, D) to bottom containers (E, F, G) using images.
Images show a board with colored markers at the top (A, B, C, D) and bottom (E, F, G), and angled baffles in the middle.
Initial state: Top containers labeled A (blue), B (yellow), C (green), D (orange); Bottom containers labeled E (yellow), F (brown), G (blue); Angled baffles between them.
Image 2 shows blue liquid from A flowing down and hitting blue horizontal baffle, redirected to the left.
Image 3 shows blue liquid continuing with yellow and green liquids, combined flow eventually reaches container E (yellow).
Liquid from A (blue) flows into container E (yellow).
Yellow liquid from B flows downward and combines with flow from A and C.
Combined liquid (yellow-green-blue mixture) in image 3 flows toward container E.
Liquid from B (yellow) flows into container E (yellow).
Green liquid from C flows downward and joins with flow from A and B.
Liquid from C (green) flows into container E (yellow).
Image 2 shows orange liquid from D flowing down and hitting angled grey baffle, redirected.
Image 3 shows orange liquid flowing along the right side, reaching container G (blue) at the bottom right.
Liquid from D (orange) flows into container G (blue).
Container F (brown) does not receive liquid from any top containers.
